title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: When the authority of the English Parliament was completely established in Edinburgh, the leaders of the army proceeded to arrange matters according to their own views. General Lambert applied to the town council of Edinburgh " to appropriate to him the East Kirk of Edinburgh, being the special kirk, and best in the town, for his exercise at sermon." The request was granted, and the pulpit was thereafter occupied by " weill giftit" captains, lieutenants, and troopers, as well as occasional English ministers, while others of the troopers taught in the Parliament House,2 and like convenient places of assembly.
